subject: Physical Fitness
title: Warm-Up Science
description: A micro-lesson that makes Warm-Up Science usable.

hook.text: Five minutes of jogging before lifting â€” is that a real warm-up or just a ritual? Science has a clear answer.

buildup.text: An effective warm-up raises muscle temperature, increases blood flow, and activates the nervous system.

discovery.text: Warm muscles are more elastic and contract more forcefully. Reaction time improves. Injury risk drops measurably.

twist.text: Static stretching before exercise can temporarily reduce strength by 5â€“10%. Dynamic warm-ups are more effective.

climax.text: The best warm-ups are specific. Warm up for squats by squatting light, not by stretching your hamstrings.

punchline.text: Warm up with movement, not stretches. Prepare for what your body will do.
